In 2005, we defeated the 49ers in front of 103,000+ fans at Estadio Azteca in the first regular-season game played in Mexico in NFL history.

In 2022, we meet again.

"This isn't just going to be a game in Mexico City. This is going to be a game with playoff implications."

@gmfb takes a closer look at our Week 11 matchup vs. the 49ers at Estadio Azteca. https://t.co/xvY2i9AuyJ

In 2021, we announced the creation of the â€œAdele Harris Scholarshipâ€ which commemorated the 50th anniversary of Harris becoming the first African American female to hold a front office position in the NFL.

Harris played a key role in the formation of Cardinals Charities, which was launched in 1990 as a vehicle to support programs designed to improve the quality of life & enhance opportunities for children, women, and minorities in Arizona.

She passed away in 2007 at the age of 65. https://t.co/eRqmlEAyGp

A Chicago native, she was raised in St. Louis and joined the Cardinals in 1971 as an assistant in the PR department. 

By 1980, Harris became Director of Community Relations and was instrumental in the teamâ€™s civic efforts when it relocated to Arizona in 1988.

Adele Harris was the first African American female to hold a front office position in the NFL.

She spent 26 years in a variety of public and community relations roles within the organization before retiring in 2001. 

#WomensHistoryMonth https://t.co/TMmSzcVOok
